item.description:
Gloomhaven is a game of Euro-inspired tactical combat in a persistent world of shifting motives. Players will take on the role of a wandering adventurer with their own special set of skills and their own reasons for traveling to this dark corner of the world. Players must work together out of necessity to clear out menacing dungeons and forgotten ruins. In the process, they will enhance their abilities with experience and loot, discover new locations to explore and plunder, and expand an ever-branching story fueled by the decisions they make.

This is a game with a persistent and changing world that is ideally played over many game sessions. After a scenario, players will make decisions on what to do, which will determine how the story continues, kind of like a “Choose Your Own Adventure” book. Playing through a scenario is a cooperative affair where players will fight against automated monsters using an innovative card system to determine the order of play and what a player does on their turn.

Each turn, a player chooses two cards to play out of their hand. The number on the top card determines their initiative for the round. Each card also has a top and bottom power, and when it is a player’s turn in the initiative order, they determine whether to use the top power of one card and the bottom power of the other, or vice-versa. Players must be careful, though, because over time they will permanently lose cards from their hands. If they take too long to clear a dungeon, they may end up exhausted and be forced to retreat.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

name.value: English edition, second printing (with Solo Scenarios)

comment.value:
Cons: -10/10 fiddliness -The time investment is ridiculous. -The monster AI system is very messy & unintuitive. 20 games in, we were still checking the rulebook constantly. -Play patterns can be repetitive. -It's very hard to keep track of the campaign story ("what is there at the Desecrated Crypt? Where do we have to go to fight the necromancer?").
Pros: -I keep wanting to play.
If it's half as good as Forge War...

Best and most addictive coop game I’ve ever played. Desperately, pondering over moves, cards, levelling up, etc. in my spare time. And not just me but also the other 3 members of my mercenary party :)

[IMG]https://cf.geekdo-static.com/mbs/mb_17587_1.png[/IMG]
Gloomhaven (second printing): BASE GAME Gloomhaven: Forgotten Circles Expansion Gloomhaven: Removable Sticker Set Gloomhaven: Forgotten Circles (Removable Sticker Set) Gloomhaven: METAL COIN UPGRADE
After one play, not completing a dungeon I’m seeing a decent tactical RPG, but struggling to see the #1 game. 2nd session, one big fight took up the whole 3 hour session. Fun, but slow.

This game is a beast. So far my group has only played 3 times, and we have loved every minute of it. The monster AI is actually good, and challenging, while not entirely over whelming. The art is great, the minis are amazing, and I love the legacy aspect of it (though instead of ripping up pieces, we made a R.I.P bag to put in cards that we were done with, and get the removable sticker set, so if we ever decide to play again or pass on the game, its all there).
My only problem, after purchasing this beat of a game, I found that there was not room to properly store all the pieces in the box without just dumping them in and hoping I could find the pieces I needed within a reasonable time. So off to the bait and tackle section of Walmart to get some off brand Plano boxes. ( For those wondering, I Pretty much just followed this thread https://boardgamegeek.com/thread/1726878/yss-yet-another-storage-solution )
All in all, amazing game, and 100%

People are talking a lot of box size, but there's a lot of content for gameplay and it's not even filled much of miniature mess, instead there's dozens of cards, tokens, cardboards and other gameplay stuff in good price. That's why you might need insert solution for content. You will spend a lot of time with this. My gaming group spend already one year (once per week), and there's still much for explore. And still learning rules, though main mechanisms are simple. You need gaming group with same mates all the campaign, but it's possible for solo; however, I would recommend to find other game for solo play, for example maybe Mage Knight or 7th Continent.

Greetings everyone!

After over 500 hours of gameplay and finishing the whole package, I decided to pass on my Gloomhaven.
It is the second print with the solo scenarios included.

The game has been completly finished, so let me give you a heads up right here:
~ The game is in a good condition. It is used over about 500 hours but has always been treated carefully and was stored appropriatly.
~ The game box endured some carrying around.
~ Some monster standees are a little torn because the included standee holders sometimes are very tight. 
~ ALL components are available, with a minor exception of the non used global achievment stickers regarding other path choices.

~ All Stickers have been mounted onto the world map, aswell as the global achievments following our playthrough; Also, a good amount of cards have been enhanced.
(We used the available stickers from the base game, NOT the removeable ones!)
~ The Worldmap has been framed into a picture frame. (I am willing to include this as a separate package if desired; if not the frame will be removed, the map folded and stored into the original box)
~ All Character boxes, envelopes and other stuff has been opened of course!

~ ALL cards have been sleeved with the original docsmagic sleeves and are additionally stored inside zip-bags if necessary. There are still a lot of left-over sleeves/bags that I will also include.
~ ALL map tiles are properly stored alphabetically in an accordion folder. 
~ ALL items are stored in a proper folder which is treated as a "shop" this way. (Locked items turned down, unlocked items faced up)
~ Road/City events, random dungeon generator and life time goals are stored in a 4-divided-limpid box.
~ ALL the remaining parts of the game have been carefully sorted and stored into plano boxes.
(My setup time never exceeded 10 minutes thanks to the orginization)
~ Some character sheets have been used. If you need more, basically all of them are available as printed .pdf-versions here on BGG.

The price includes FREE shipping in most parts of EU, however I am willing to ship worldwide, so write a message if you are interested from abroad.
You can pay via PayPal friends or Bank Wire Transfer.

If you have any questions or want to see some additional pictures feel free to send me a message! :)

The game is practically like new, cards still in their original packaging to be opened, all the material is still sealed, has only been punched, plus I add removable stickers.

Payment can be done by:

A. Bank transfer
B. Paypal

My deck organizer will really up your Gloomhaven game. We all love Gloomhaven, but really adding some organization can make the whole experience way better. Your buddy Mike is gonna spill his beer someday, and mess up your cards. the day will come when Suzie scatters everything with a good sneeze. Be honest, you don't want that. Get my friggin' dope organizer and parry the wiles of game day mayhem; only then will you be truly winning. 

Let me know which color you prefer, I've got red, blue, black, yellow, grey, purple, white, and green!

Ships FREE domestically from Texas! Message me, for any international shipping arrangements. Thank you!

You can find more of my HUGE selection of organizers here: https://www.etsy.com/shop/M3is3D

Look guys, you don't need all that.

Sure, you could pay $25 and get a player dashboard that props up your cards instead of them laying on the table, but why? Why is putting those cards in a slot worth a full $16?

Just get my super-cool, sleek dashboard, and you'll be playing in style without shelling out a ridiculous amount of coin, for no real reason. Let me know which color you prefer, I've got red, blue, black, yellow, grey, purple, white, and green!

Also, if you want to get a set for your whole crew, we can work something out.

Ships from Austin, Texas! Check out my other Gloomhaven stuff, I have some really great deck organizers and stuff you'll probably love. Have a great day!

You can find more of my HUGE selection of organizers here: https://www.etsy.com/shop/M3is3D

You know it, I know it, organization is key. Your Gloomhaven game is gonna rock with this character organizer!

Accommodates ability, attack modifier and item cards in separate dividers, plus class tokens and the miniature (for most classes). For storage, the health/xp dial, character sheet and character mat/card are placed on top.

You can totally use during play also, so it's really a win-win. This organizer would also probably work for many other tabletop games, like Scythe, Founders of Gloomhaven, Terraforming Mars, etc.

Works with sleeved cards! Let me know which color you prefer, I've got red, blue, black, yellow, grey, purple, white, and green!

Help pass the days stuck in home with this deluxe Wall and Floor set for Gloomhaven the Boardgame. 
-I built this set using the plans from Hirst Arts (https://www.hirstarts.com/gloom/gloom.html). I played through the entire campaign using this set and it adds soo much to our game nights. You become much more immersed with the 3D set and it looks gorgeous on the table. 
-All pieces are made out of dental stone, molded, primed and hand inked and painted.
-The bottom of each piece is layered with cork or foam so table tops are not scratched.
-The pieces have a satisfying weight to them.
A substantial amount of time went into building this set, over 80 hours ? Each piece needs to be built individually and glued together. Then primed, dry brushed with numerous layers, lacquered with a matte finish, bottom finished with cork or foam, and finally labeled (floor tiles).
-The floor tiles are labeled to correspond with the tiles in the game. Pictured below is scenario 1. I built the scenario showing double doors because I thought it looked cool, but you can build it anyway you want. This shows the flexibility you have when building the rooms. Floor tiles required for that scenario are L, G, and I. I have a label on the back of each tile.
Whats included:
All floor pieces to run every scenario in the base game. -30-
Enough wall pieces to run any scenario in the base game -54-
6 doors molded and painted
6 crates
2 tables
3 barrels
6 single floor spaces to link boards together.
-Once purchased I will send you a video to make a storage box. Unfortunately, with shipping constraints I'm not able to send the box I normally used to store the pieces. With pick up you'll have the storage boxes.
-This set is unfortunately heavy. Shipping base cost is set to $100. I will adjust from there for location. The optimal purchase would be pickup, I understand that's not always available.

If you have further questions/pictures please reach out to me ?
En franÃ§ais, new in shrink, please contact me for shipping costs first (heavy box)

ULTIMATE handmade Gloomhaven terrain set, fully painted and ready to play, 102 pieces for every scenario!

Gloomhaven is one of the best boardgames ever made, and it only serves it well to have the best terrain set to go along with it. So that's what we made :) This is fully painted resin set, ready to play right out of the box, consisting of no less than 102 pieces! Every model is addressed with extreme care to attention and detail, to provide you the greatest campaign experience a boardgame can offer. Once you set it up on the table, an entire game changes completely. You are no longer facing opponents on the flat board, but rather across 3d landscape that is painted and detailed to a high gaming standard.

This ultimate set consists all the necessary elements for every scenario to be paid fully with terrain, and we tried to add as many variants as possible, so you don't have repeated models on the table. Every model is hand painted, and most have very cool and intricate details that will help you immerse fully into the scenarios and bring 3d element into your battles.
Please note that there may be variations in the set you receive from the one shown in pictures, mostly in shape of the bushes, different books and potion placements, and various individual elements that we add later on by hand. This certainly doesn't mean less details, just different ones due to big variety.
This set consists of:
5x treasure tile
2x table
3x barrel
6x totem
2x crate
6x stone pillar
4x altar
6x rubble
6x bush
2x cabinet
4x bookcase
2x shelf
6x boulder
4x large boulder
4x huge boulder
1x fountain
6x wall section
6x stalagmites
6x rock column
3x tree
4x stairs
5x stump
3x log
2x crystal

I bought this but the game is far too complex for my family's skill level so we literally tried to play it once and switched to Jaws of the Lion which was more appropriate for us. It is brand new in pristine condition and, with the pressouts all done ready to go. It includes:

1) Gloomhaven wooden organiser from Towerrex ($72 new)
2) Gloomhaven stickers (still sealed)
3) Gloom haven forgotten circles (still sealed)
4) Gloomhaven forgotten circles expansion pack (still sealed)

Less than 10 of the map stickers have been placed on the board and a couple of checkboxes in the quest book are checked, but aside from that the game is in great condition. Also, I am including the already put together Broken Token insert which makes set up and tear down WAY easier.

We have played roughly the first 8 or so missions so those stickers are on the map. We have not destroyed any of the components when prompted (event cards, etc.). We simply found after a few plays that the game was not for us! Feel free to message me if you would like more info.

***New, In Shrink.***

Shipping is USPS flat rate to the USA

-OR-

Local Pickup in-store (343 S. Robertson Blvd, Beverly Hills, CA 90211)

***A Bit About Our Store:***

We are an online AND brick and mortar game shop located in the Los Angeles/Robertson/Beverly Hills area. The store is a labor of love between friends and brought to you by avid gamers.

Focusing on hobbyist games as well as popular family board games and miniatures gaming, we hope to have something for everyone! We are a licensed Games Workshop stockist and have a 3d printing service as well, for pre-printed and custom products. We also carry gaming accessories and collectibles. We will carry the new, hot games as well as many timeless classics from all of the current publishers. We will also sell Kickstarter exclusive games/editions from time to time.

Our Brick and Mortar shop will share our online prices, so whether you visit us in person or order via the internet, you'll get the same competitive prices you are accustomed to online, and we ship nation-wide! Our prices here on BGG mirror our low prices, and we are happy to sell on BGG to help support this wonderful community.

If you live in the Los Angeles area, we will have in-store events, classes, and hope to be a gaming hub for years to come.

If you don't live in the LA area but would love to support a Brick and Mortar shop, we ship all over the USA and you'll see that our prices are competitive with the top online retailers!

We TRULY appreciate your business!

[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size] 

[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.

[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). 

[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.

[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money. 

[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).

[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.


[size=14][b]I take responsibility for the safe delivery of your order:[/b][/size] I am a registered commercial seller. Thus, insofar as you are a private consumer, it is required by German law that I take responsibility for any loss or damage of goods that occurs during shipment.

I can also make [size=12][b]special orders[/b][/size] for items that I don't have in stock. Send me a message concerning an item, and I will check for availability and tell you what the price would be.

This game is relatively brand new. It's been in a smoke-free, humidity-controlled Kallax game shelf since we bought it in 2019 brand new from the game store. We also added the incredibly awesome Go7Gaming storage solution, by itself a $100 value, and the Gloomhaven metal coins from the Frosthaven KS, a $20 value. The whole package cost us over $220, and it's been cared for greatly. We (the two of us) only played three scenarios with no other players, and didn't throw away or tear up a single card. Every single component is present and accounted for, and if you want a full inventory confirmation of the components, I will accommodate that request. This is the huge base game only, and does not include any expansion content except the Dice Tower scenario from their 2019 KS (a little bonus for you).

This game will NOT be inexpensive to ship, so be warned. The box is 16"L x 12"W x 8.5"D, and weighs a beastly 27.5 lbs. (12.47kg). Can do local pickup if you're in the Pittsburgh, PA or surrounding area.

Buyer pays shipping.

[size=14][b]Payment Options:[/b][/size] 

[size=12][b]Paypal:[/b][/size] No fee is charged to you, if you pay using Paypal. But Paypal does not change currency at the fair market rate. So you will lose 3% or more of your money, if you are converting to Euros.

[size=12][b]IBAN Bank Transfer:[/b][/size] Payment by bank transfer is possible using an IBAN compatible account. [b]There is a 3% discount if you pay using IBAN Bank Transfer[/b] (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). 

[size=12][b]Wise:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Wise (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and charges the sender a fee of about 0.5% of the amount of money sent.

[size=12][b]Revolut:[/b][/size] There is a 3% discount if you pay using Revolut (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less). The company does currency conversion at the fair market rate, and there are no fees to send money. 

[size=12][b]Interac e-transfer:[/b][/size] If you have a Canadian bank account (like me), then you can pay by Interac e-transfer. In this case, you pay in Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. There is also a 3% discount, if you pay using Interac e-transfer (i.e., your total payment due is 3% less).

[size=12][b]Payment in Dollars:[/b][/size] It is possible to make Paypal payments in US or Canadian dollars, at the fair market exchange rate. You will automatically receive this option, if your address is in the USA or Canada.
